title: India trashes Pakistan's allegations of Indian link to Islamabad bombing
content: ‚ÄúIt is unfortunate that, instead of seriously addressing the problems plaguing its social fabric, Pakistan should choose to delude itself by blaming others for its home-grown ills,‚Äù the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Tripura council poll: no alliance call yet by BJP, ally IPFT keen on tie-up
content: Move comes close on the heels of a statement by CM Manik Saha, who hinted at independently contesting the election to the tribal district council

title: Over the years, DMK and Congress have forged a mutually complementary electoral tie-up
content: In the 2024 Lok Sabha election, even though the national party lagged behind the Dravidian party in terms of vote share in contested seats, the margin was less than one percentage point; the narrow gap in vote shares indicates that all the parties in the alliance benefit from one another

title: Engineers should evince interest in defence research, says NITI Aayog member
content: The Centre has significantly increased the allocation for defence sector to ensure that India‚Äôs defence capabilities remain globally competitive, says Saraswat

title: Top Maoist leader Prabhakar, six others killed in Gadchiroli operations
content: One C-60 jawan died during operation, another injured; the police have so far recovered three AK-47 rifles, one SLR and one .303 rifle from the location

title: Class 8 student allegedly raped while returning from school in Mauganj, M.P.
content: An FIR has been filed at the Mauganj police station for gang-rape and abduction, and two of the accused have been arrested

title: Kerala MP moves private Bill to conduct Census every ten years
content: Bill introduced in RS by IUML MP Haris Beeran notes six-year delay in Census after 2011; warns that reservation and other social justice policies cannot be pursued effectively without correct population and caste data

title: U.P. SIR gets fourth extension, final voter list in April
content: Election Commission says it extended the period for filing of claims and objections by 30 days following a request from the State‚Äôs Chief Electoral Officer

title: Work on second phase of metro likely to be completed by Dec. 2026, says¬†KMRL
content: KMRL¬†managing director cites delays in piling caused by detection of a gas pipeline between¬†Alinchuvadu¬†and¬†Padamugal, and the unavailability of land for¬†Chembumukku¬†and¬†Padamugal¬†stations as major obstacles to meeting the June deadline

title: Amit Shah seeks ‚Äòhi-tech solutions' on J&K border as UAVs create a security headache
content: Emerging challenges driven by advanced technology must be countered with equally advanced technological solutions. The challenges faced some years ago are completely different from those faced today, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: CPI(M) MP moves Right to Disconnect Bill in Rajya Sabha
content: Bill seeks strict enforcement of official working hours; MP says the ‚Äòalways-on‚Äô digital work culture has taken a toll on employees

title: Modi signed a ‚Äòtrap deal‚Äô on U.S. pressure: Congress
content: Kharge says PM surrendered before Trump because of Epstein files, sacrificed India‚Äôs farmers, and has no courage to face Opposition queries; MPs say govt. failed to share details of trade agreement

title: UDF to spotlight ‚ÄòKerala crisis‚Äô in Puthuyuga Yatra
content: The 30-day yatra aims to engage citizens and showcase a vision for a reformed Kerala. Front leaders highlight financial distress, youth migration, and failing governance under the LDF, accusing the government of shielding gold smuggling suspects.

title: ED attaches properties worth ‚Çπ7.81 crore in cheating case
content: The attachment was made as equivalent value to the proceeds of crime under Section 5(1) of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002

title: Itinerant tiger leaves fresh pug marks in Jangaon district
content: Forest Department informed that the pug marks were found outside the Mandelagudem village in Raghunathpally mandal of Jangaon district on Friday

title: Differently abled voters need to queue up for SIR hearings in West Bengal despite ECI directives
content: Despite Election Commission exemptions, differently abled persons report long waits, inadequate¬†facilities¬†and distress during SIR¬†hearing

title: Quantum ecosystem in Amaravati will benefit generations, says APSCHE chief
content: Amaravati Quantum Valley Hackathon- 2025 sees participation of 50,000 students from across six States

title: Service organisations welcome five-day week proposal for govt. staff
content: Weekly loss of seven working hours resulting from a  five-day week can be made up by rearranging daily working hours, suggest organisations

title: Supreme Court allows abortion of 30-week pregnancy of a minor, upholds right to reproductive autonomy
content: The court also said that there were cases in which women may have no other option but take the dangerous and life-threatening alternative of turning to quacks for an abortion

title: Suspicious death: viscera samples, phone of PG doctor sent to FSL
content: Body of Dr. Deepika handed over to parents; Women‚Äôs Commission Chairperson Rayapati Sailaja enquires about the case

title: CyberPeace Summit 2026 to address cybercrime, AI risks, misinformation
content: Global CyberPeace Summit in New Delhi to focus on digital governance, infrastructure protection, and online safety challenges

title: Thiruvananthapuram tops list of districts with most number of stray dog bites
content: 58,108 persons sought treatment for stray dog bites in the district‚Äôs government hospitals in 2025. Kerala reported 3.69 lakh dog bites last year

title: Accused of dropping Chabahar under U.S. pressure, Centre says it is engaged with all stakeholders
content: Iranian Ambassador says India has conveyed no information on future of project; MEA tells Parliament India has disbursed its total commitment of ‚Çπ120 million before the U.S. sanctions waiver ends in April

title: ED summons actor Jayaram in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: The actor had then denied any wrongdoing and said he had no links with the company where the replating of gold-clad artefacts of the temple was done or its sponsors

title: Tadoba tiger that swam two rivers and crossed three States tranquilised in East Godavari
content: After a 53-day movement through forest corridors and inhabited areas, the transient male tiger is secured in a cattle shed at Kurmapuram village on Friday evening, forest officials say. They add that the animal does not attack any human during its long journey and is in stable condition, with a decision yet to be taken on shifting it to a zoo or a rescue centre

title: Will consider high-speed rail if State interested, says Union Minister
content: Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says in Rajya Sabha that the SilverLine semi-high-speed rail project proposed by Kerala is not feasible as it will major environmental impact

title: Top Maoist couple carrying ‚Çπ1 crore reward surrender in Odisha; 19 Maoists lay down arms
content: Odisha Police say Left Wing Extremism waning as CPI (Maoist) cadres surrender in Rayagada; weapons seized

title: Electricity Regulatory Commission proposes ‚Äòautomatic compensation mechanism‚Äô for power distribution licencees such as KSEB
content: The consumer shall be automatically compensated, without the need for any claim, upon automatic identification of a default in the performance of the distribution licensee in parameters such as power failure, say draft regulations

title: Kerala government reiterates stand against NPR; issues fresh notification ahead of Census
content: According to the Chief Minister‚Äôs Office, the notification has been issued to remove any ambiguity amid speculation that the NPR could be conducted along with the Census exercise

title: SCTIMST organising MedTech Ideathon on February 21
content: Event meant for UG/PG students in science, engineering, medical, dental or paramedical streams, who may have an inclination for medical technology

title: Kerala HC directs imposing of fine on unauthorised boards, banners in public spaces
content: Court directs joint secretaries of Local Self-Government department to conduct special drives to remove unauthorised hoardings

title: Will explore all legal avenues to expose ‚ÄòJungle Raj‚Äô in Andhra Pradesh, says Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Contrary to Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu‚Äôs claims, the court-monitored CBI investigation has conclusively established that there is no animal fat in the ghee used for preparing Tirumala laddu, asserts the YSRCP chief

title: Anomie movie review: Bhavana‚Äôs sci-fi thriller failed by too many derivative elements
content: For long portions, the screenplay meanders along without any eventful turns. Consequently, the film fails to be engaging except in the latter portions of the investigation

title: Tension prevails as villagers block forest officials‚Äô entry to Kolleru Lake
content: Opposing demolition drive against illegal fish tanks, residents say that they will continue to protest till the boundary disputes of the sanctuary is resolved

title: Government ropes in students for governance feedback through college consultations
content: Institutions have been instructed to conduct student group discussions to collect suggestions and ideas related to governance and development

title: AICC caught in a tangle as MPs seek Assembly seats
content: With at least half a dozen MPs expressing interest in State politics, the AICC seeks to balance organisational stability in Parliament against the demand to field leaders with local clout to counter LDF and revive the UDF‚Äôs electoral fortunes

title: Dewaswom Board initiates comprehensive changes in Sabarimala pilgrimage
content: A separate Budget will be prepared exclusively for the festival, in addition to the TDB‚Äôs general Budget; special training will be given to all Devaswom employees who will be part of Sabarimala duty in the months of August and September

title: CM will decide bifurcation of Belagavi district: Satish Jarkiholi
content: Public Works Minister Satish Jarkiholi says that any decision on bifurcation of Belagavi district will have to be taken by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah

title: Mineral-rich A.P. stands to gain from Rare Earth Corridor plan, says official
content: State has the mineral deposits spread in about 16,000 hectares, of which superior quality minerals have been identified mostly in Visakhapatnam and Srikakulam districts, according to APMDC vice-chairman and MD Pravin Kumar

title: One-stop Super Bowl cheat sheet: Everything you need to know about Seahawks-Patriots
content: We have picks, bold predictions, X factors, key matchups, betting notes and more for Super Bowl LX between the Seahawks and Patriots.

title: NHL prospect McKenna has felony charge dropped
content: Penn State hockey star Gavin McKenna will have his felony aggravated assault charge dropped, the Centre County District Attorney's Office announced Friday.

title: QB Mendoza: Combine throwing not a 'priority'
content: Indiana quarterback and presumptive No. 1 pick Fernando Mendoza explained his decision not to throw during the NFL scouting combine, saying he preferred to use the opportunity to help his Hoosiers teammates at a pro day.

title: Browns DC Schwartz exits after lost coaching bid
content: Jim Schwartz has resigned as Browns defensive coordinator after he missed out on his bid to be the head coach.

title: Sources: Conley, Wolves work on quick reunion
content: Mike Conley Jr. plans to return to the Timberwolves, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania. Conley was traded by Minnesota this week, then traded again and waived, allowing for his return.

title: Four-time WNBA All-Star Jones tears meniscus
content: Four-time WNBA All-Star Brionna Jones suffered a meniscus tear last week while playing for USK Praha but should be ready for the WNBA season.

title: Hall of Fame quarterback Jurgensen dies at 91
content: Hall of Fame quarterback Sonny Jurgensen, who has held franchise passing records for Philadelphia and Washington for more than five decades, has died at the age of 91.

title: Point blank: Books want low-scoring Super Bowl
content: Even with one of the lowest betting totals in a decade, sportsbooks will still be rooting for Super Bowl LX to be a low-scoring affair.

title: Overinflated story: FIS pans viral cheating rumor
content: The regulatory body for skiing on Friday dismissed as a "wild rumor" reports that ski jumpers are enhancing their groin area to gain distance as the Winter Olympics begins.

title: üí∞ The 60 bets to make on Super Bowl 60
content: We navigated the thousands of bets being offered for Super Bowl LX and narrowed it down to our 60 favorite from 10 different categories.

title: Milan Cortina Olympics: Best moments from the Games' opening ceremony
content: The 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics officially got underway Friday. Here are the top moments from the opening ceremony.

title: 'It's over. Guys are gone': What James Harden and the Clippers realized before the shocking trade
content: The Harden trade was a mutual recognition as much as an admission -- that the 11-time All-Star had a better chance to win elsewhere, and a tumultuous era in LA was effectively over.

title: What NBA insiders are watching amid trade deadline aftermath
content: Tim Bontemps canvasses the league after the deadline's grand finale, which now sets up a fascinating summer.

title: Swami Sez: Chris Berman picks the winner of Super Bowl LX
content: Boomer has correctly picked the winner in five of the past seven years. Which preseason long shot is he picking Sunday?

title: The team that Mike Vrabel built: ÔªøHow the Patriots found success so fast
content: There were five key points over the past year that set New England on track to face the Seahawks on Sunday.

title: Making sense of trade deadline week: We picked the real winners and losers
content: After a wild week of superstar movement, Zach Kram unveils his winners and losers of the NBA trade deadline.

title: Super Bowl LX betting buzz: Bettor places $1,000 MVP wagers on Super Bowl kickers
content: Multiple sportsbooks have reported taking MVP wagers on long shots, including a variety of Seahawks defenders.

title: Men's Bracketology: Saint Louis could be a real threat come March
content: The Billikens are an analytical unicorn -- and shaping up to be the Atlantic 10's next generational team.

title: Lunardi's Bracketology tiers for every high-major conference
content: Breaking down the March Madness potential for every team from the ACC, Big East, Big Ten, Big 12 and SEC.

title: Women's Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: America's Super Bowl LX game plan: Couches, wings and wagers
content: From Seahawks support to Bad Bunny buzz, a national survey reveals how fans are watching, eating and wagering on Super Bowl Sunday.

title: Who you calling old? At the 2026 Olympics, age is just a number
content: Lindsey Vonn, Nick Goepper, Gus Kenworthy and Maddy Schaffrick are in their golden years at the 2026 Olympics. Just don't call them old.

title: An intradivision swap? Houston making moves? MLB trade proposals that could shake up the start of spring training
content: Who has too many players at one position? Who has a big hole to fill? We found the biggest and propose deals to fix the imbalances.

title: Olney and Passan's offseason lessons -- and what they mean for baseball's future
content: From more outrage over big spending to the deals that never happened, here's what we learned this winter.

title: No Spanish? No problem: Bad Bunny promises a party at halftime
content: Ahead of Sunday's halftime show, Bad Bunny reassured fans that his performance is meant to be felt, not translated.

title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks-Patriots marks latest rematch in big game
content: This year marks the 10th different repeat Super Bowl matchup and the fourth in which the Patriots are involved.

title: Wetzel: Standing on the brink of anything-goes NCAA eligibility
content: By not controlling who is eligible, the NCAA is losing the ability to function as an organizing athletic body.

title: The best of the 2026 recruiting class, by position
content: How elite are the Nos. 1 and 2 recruits in the 2026 class? We analyze each position and break down who can be sleepers.

title: Reid's updated NFL draft rankings: Who jumped up the board after the Senior Bowl?
content: Jordan Reid ranked the top 50 players in the 2026 NFL draft class, including scouting reports and standouts at every position.

title: Fight managers outline how the revamped PFL can be successful
content: With new leadership and stars such as Usman Nurmagomedov on the roster, does the PFL have all the right pieces?

title: Boxing real or not: Gervonta will fight again, Garcia finally wins a title, more
content: Our panel discusses Gervonta Davis' future, Ryan Garcia's title chances, Tyson Fury's return and more.

title: Carrick has restored hope to Man United, but it's what comes next that matters
content: Michael Carrick's three-game winning streak has certainly lifted the mood at Old Trafford. But building on this early form will truly test Man United's mettle.

title: Road to $1M paydays: How WNBA salaries evolved with each CBA
content: For the first time, a $1 million base salary is expected in the new WNBA CBA, and the cap could see a 230% increase.

title: From AD and Harden to Zubac and Vucevic: Fantasy reaction to the latest NBA trades
content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona to activate Rashford clause for permanent deal
content: Barcelona have decided to sign Marcus Rashford, while Chelsea are eyeing Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: How seven new high-speed rail corridors can transform train travel in India
content: The Union Budget 2026 announced seven high-speed rail corridors to enhance travel speed, safety, and comfort. The bullet trains, along with already operational Vande Bharat Sleeper and Amrit Bharat Express trains will improve connectivity and passenger experience.

title: 'Deluding itself': MEA hits back after Pak sees India hand in blast that killed 31
content: India has vehemently rejected Pakistan's claims linking New Delhi to a suicide bombing at an Islamabad mosque, calling the allegations "baseless and pointless." Pakistan's defence minister had alleged collusion between India and Afghanistan, which India dismissed as self-delusion for internal problems. The attack killed at least 31 people.

title: Top Jaish, LeT men call for jihad, threaten to strike Delhi, Agra
content: Top commanders from Pakistan-based terror groups JeM and LeT have issued direct threats against India and global powers during rallies coinciding with 'Kashmir Solidarity Day'.  Speeches incited violence, calling for jihad and targeting major Indian cities like Delhi and Agra.  Intelligence agencies are on high alert for potential cross-border attacks.

title: Minor has right over reproductive choice: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court permitted a minor's pregnancy termination, acknowledging her right to reproductive autonomy and the lifelong trauma of an illegitimate child. Despite the Maharashtra government's concerns about a 30-week fetus's viability and the suggestion of an orphanage, the court prioritized the girl's mental well-being, directing the procedure with medical safeguards.

title: Iran backs Chabahar port, ready to expand ties with India
content: Iran reaffirms its commitment to the Chabahar port and cooperation with India, despite US sanctions uncertainty. While a recent budget showed no allocation, India has fulfilled its $120 million commitment and maintains a $250 million credit line for future development. Iran's ambassador highlighted the port's strategic importance for regional access and expressed confidence in India's management of the situation.

title: Moon-bound again: 4 astronauts will fly farther than anyone since 1970s
content: Four astronauts are set for a 10-day deep-space journey aboard the Artemis II mission, marking humanity's return beyond low-Earth orbit after five decades. This lunar flyby will test new spacecraft and partnerships, validating crucial systems for future lunar landings and Mars missions. The mission prioritizes crew health and scientific observation, paving the way for sustained lunar exploration.

title: Elon Musk on his 'hiring problem' at SpaceX: Hard to get engineers with families to ‚Ä¶
content: SpaceX faces a significant hurdle in attracting engineers and technicians to its Starbase facility in South Texas due to limited job prospects for their spouses. Elon Musk highlighted this 'significant other' problem, noting the remote location's scarcity of non-SpaceX employment. This challenge, though less pronounced, also affects Tesla's recruitment in Texas.

title: Lowering age of consent will undermine child safety: Govt
content: The Union government has rejected the Supreme Court's suggestion to introduce a "Romeo-Juliet" clause for "genuine adolescent relationships" under the Pocso Act. Citing child safety concerns, the government stated that diluting the age of consent would increase exploitation risks and undermine child protection efforts.

title: Can't misuse judiciary after poll drubbing: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court sternly criticized the Jan Suraaj Party for challenging Bihar's assembly elections, questioning their motive after a significant electoral defeat. Justices noted the party's failure to win any seats and suggested their petition aimed at gaining popularity. The court emphasized that economic policy issues are for voters to address, not judicial annulment of elections.

title: Exports to China up 37% in Apr-Dec: Minister
content: India's exports to China surged 37% to $14.2 billion in April-December, with December shipments jumping 67%. Imports, however, rose 13.5% to nearly $96 billion during the same period. The government highlighted that most Chinese imports are capital and intermediate goods, crucial for India's expanding electronics, pharma, and telecom sectors.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.

title: T20 WC: Strength in spin, questions in batting for inconsistent Pakistan
content: Pakistan enters the T20 World Cup seeking a second title, relying on key batters and all-rounders Saim Ayub and Mohammad Nawaz. Despite mixed results since the last tournament, including away series losses, home wins and strong spin performances offer positives. However, concerns remain regarding the batting strike rate and Babar Azam's anchor role.

title: 'Done by staffer': White House calls Trump's racist Obamas post a mistake; takes it down
content: A racist video featuring edited images of the Obamas was mistakenly posted on Donald Trump's social media account by a White House staffer and has since been removed. The offensive content, which repeated false election claims, sparked immediate condemnation from Democratic leaders and former officials. Trump's spokeswoman dismissed the backlash as 'fake outrage'.

title: Supreme Court to examine HP decision to withdraw cases against 65 netas
content: Himachal Pradesh government has approached the Supreme Court. They are challenging a High Court ruling. The ruling prevented the withdrawal of 65 cases against politicians. These cases involve non-serious offenses. The government believes withdrawing these cases serves public interest. The Supreme Court has issued a notice and will hear the matter further.

title: ‚ÄòIn 36 months, the cheapest place to put AI will be ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Musk makes a bold prediction
content: Elon Musk predicts space will soon host the most cost-effective AI data centers, potentially within three years. He highlighted space's superior solar energy capture, lack of atmospheric interference, and absence of day-night cycles, eliminating the need for batteries. Musk also downplayed concerns about GPU reliability in large-scale AI training, suggesting they become dependable after initial debugging.

title: Pvt, more than govt, colleges gain from NEET PG cut-off drop
content: NEET PG cut-off reduction to zero in 2023 disproportionately benefited private medical colleges, especially for clinical specialties. General category candidates saw the largest gains, with a significant portion of these seats going to them. The analysis highlights admissions with extremely low scores, raising questions about data completeness.

title: In a 1st, resolution professional held by ED for colluding with promoters of bankrupt co
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Arvind Kumar, a former resolution professional for Richa Industries Ltd., on charges of collusion, asset siphoning, and money laundering during insolvency proceedings. This marks the first such arrest of an RP by an enforcement agency. The ED's investigation revealed unexplained cash deposits and illicit fund transfers linked to the company's original bank fraud.

title: 75+ happy rose day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2026
content: February 7, 2026, marks Rose Day, initiating Valentine's Week. The article offers over 75 messages, quotes, and greetings for various relationships, emphasizing the symbolic meaning of rose colors.

title: Lady Gaga praises Bad Bunny, says ‚Äòworld will feel his heart‚Äô before Super Bowl
content: With Super Bowl LIX being just a few hours away, fans are waiting for the Grammy winner Bad Bunny to take the stage in Levi Stadium, California. While the teams gear up to face each other for one final match, Lady Gaga has opened up about Bad Bunny and the advice she has for him as a former Super Bowl halftime performance headliner.

title: NHL trade buzz: Wings after Stanley, Schenn; Preds consider O‚ÄôReilly, Stamkos
content: The Detroit Red Wings pursue defensive improvements before the upcoming trade deadline by evaluating Logan Stanley, Luke Schenn, and Justin Faulk as potential acquisition targets, according to league sources. The Nashville Predators experience instability after Barry Trotz decided to resign from his position as general manager, while Ryan O'Reilly and Steven Stamkos remain popular trade targets.

title: Super Bowl halftime shows that set records from Jackson to Lamar
content: The Super Bowl halftime show has grown from simple band performances into a global cultural moment. Artists like New Kids on the Block, Gloria Estefan, Prince, Janet Jackson, Kendrick Lamar, and Rihanna each changed its direction. Some moments broke records, others changed rules, but all helped turn halftime into one of the most watched stages in the world.

title: Pahalgam shadow on Omar‚Äôs budget: Special hospitals for shelling-prone zones
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah presented a Rs 1.27-lakh crore budget for 2026-27, addressing challenges from recent attacks and floods. The budget includes provisions for emergency hospitals, bullet-proof ambulances, fee waivers for economically weaker students, and support for orphans and disabled individuals. Opposition leaders criticized the budget, calling it uninspiring and a repackaging of central schemes.

title: 50 lakh bought FASTag Annual Pass; 50% rise in short trips
content: Over 50 lakh highway car users have embraced the FASTag Annual Pass in six months, facilitating 26.5 crore toll payments. This scheme has spurred a 50% surge in trips for frequent travelers, with 28% of car transactions now utilizing the pass. Chandigarh, Tamil Nadu, and Delhi lead in adoption, paving the way for barrier-less toll collection.

title: Toll on partially opened e-ways like Delhi-Mumbai to be same as that of other NHs
content: Commuters using partially operational expressways like Delhi-Mumbai will now pay the same toll as normal national highways. This relief, effective for one year or until full operationalization, addresses concerns that higher tolls deterred usage of incomplete stretches. The decision aims to boost traffic on these corridors.

title: 'I want to give you Rs 2 in alms': Owaisi hits out at Himanta over 'Miya' remark
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's remarks targeting "Miya Muslims," deeming them unconstitutional and divisive. Owaisi accused Sarma of scapegoating the community for various issues and using intimidation for political gain, asserting that India's Constitution guarantees equality for all citizens.

title: 'Blew himself up after being stopped at gate': What we know about deadly blast in Pak
content: A devastating suicide bombing at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, Pakistan, claimed at least 31 lives and injured over 160 during Friday prayers. The attacker detonated himself after being stopped at the imambargah's gate. Authorities are investigating the incident, with initial reports suggesting foreign links. This attack follows recent violence in the region.

title: U19 WC Final: Sooryavanshi demolition job leads India to record sixth title
content: India U19 clinched their sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title with a dominant 100-run win over England U19 at Harare Sports Club. Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls, the fastest 150 in U19 history. India posted 411/9, and despite Caleb Falconer‚Äôs 115, England fell short at 311, as India‚Äôs bowlers maintained control.

title: How Trump's claims on tariffs are far from reality
content: President Trump claims tariffs have created an "American economic miracle," but facts suggest a mixed reality. While GDP growth has been strong, data on inflation, stock market performance, and trade deficits often contradicts his optimistic pronouncements. Investment pledges, though substantial, are also subject to scrutiny and uncertainty.

title: From Balaji Krishnamurthy to Rahul Patil: Top Indian-origin executives in Silicon Valley
content: Indian-origin leaders have profoundly shaped Silicon Valley's tech landscape, driving innovation from AI to cloud computing. These executives, often starting with strong technical foundations, navigated challenges to reach top positions, contributing significantly to global platforms and the industry's future direction. Their journey highlights a powerful synergy between talent and opportunity within the American tech ecosystem.

title: ‚ÄòNo limits, no transparency, no controls‚Äô: US accuses China of covert nuclear tests
content: The US has accused China of secretly conducting nuclear tests, urging Beijing to join arms control talks as the New START treaty expires. While Russia and the US acknowledge the need for urgent negotiations, China rejects the claims and refuses to participate, citing its smaller arsenal. This raises fears of a new nuclear arms race.

title: A stage 4 cancer case that needed more than standard chemotherapy
content: A Bhiwadi woman with advanced abdominal cancer, unresponsive to traditional chemotherapy, found a new lease on life. She underwent Cytoreductive Surgery and HIPEC, a targeted approach involving tumor removal and a heated chemotherapy wash. This transformative treatment led to a rapid recovery and a return to an active, cancer-free life.

title: 'Proud of our team': PM Modi congratulates Team India after U19 World Cup victory
content: India‚Äôs U-19 cricket team clinched their sixth ICC U-19 World Cup title with a dominant 412-run total against England at Harare Sports Club. Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls. Praises poured in from PM Modi, Vice-President CP Radhakrishnan, President Murmu, and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar. England fell short, giving India a historic, record-extending triumph.

title: T20 WC: Harshit Rana ruled out of tournament; Siraj named replacement
content: India's Harshit Rana has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup 2026 due to a knee injury sustained during a warm-up match against South Africa. Mohammed Siraj has been named as his replacement. The BCCI confirmed Rana's unfitness after specialist assessment and scans.

title: From Kohli to Mhatre: Check U19 WC winners list as India beat England
content: India U19 claimed their sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title in 2026, defeating England U19 by 100 runs at Harare Sports Club. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi starred with 175 off 80 balls, while captain Ayush Mhatre and Kanishk Chouhan contributed crucial knocks. England‚Äôs chase faltered under consistent Indian bowling, handing India a dominant win and extending their rich U19 legacy.

title: US-Iran nuclear talks: Tehran strikes 'positive' note - what was discussed in Oman
content: Iran's foreign minister described mediated talks with the US in Oman as a "good start" for nuclear discussions, expressing optimism for a positive framework if the current path continues. Both sides agreed to further discussions, with Iran conveying its concerns and interests while the US seeks to address its missile program and regional support.

title: Run over, bludgeoned, throat slit: Hyderabad lawyer murdered over land; brother ‚Äòpaid‚Äô killers
content: A land dispute tragically led to the murder of advocate G Swapna Kumari in Hyderabad. Her elder brother, G Raju, along with three associates, has been arrested. Raju allegedly orchestrated the attack, offering land to accomplices for eliminating his sister over a four-acre ancestral property. Police are investigating prior accident complaints filed by the victim against her brother.

title: Seven Naxals killed in Gadchiroli, including top leader; special force jawan succumbs to injuries
content: Seven Naxals, including top leader Prabhakar with a Rs 25 lakh bounty, were killed in an encounter with Maharashtra police in Gadchiroli. The operation, launched three days ago, also resulted in the death of a special force jawan, Deepak Chinna Madavi, while another jawan is out of danger. The anti-Naxal operation is ongoing.

title: Beyond Mumbai & Goa: How India‚Äôs tourism map is quietly changing
content: India's tourism landscape is rapidly evolving beyond beaches and hills. A new generation is flocking to spiritual and heritage sites like Ayodhya and Varanasi, driven by religious revival, infrastructure growth, and social media influence. These destinations are now vibrant, year-round hubs attracting diverse travellers seeking cultural immersion and authentic experiences.

title: What are OC and CC in real estate and why are these important
content: First-time homebuyers must understand the crucial roles of Completion Certificates (CC) and Occupancy Certificates (OC) in real estate. The CC verifies lawful construction as per approved plans, while the OC confirms a building's safety and readiness for habitation, ensuring legal occupancy and access to essential utilities.

title: Bihar MP Pappu Yadav Arrested In 1995 Land Dispute Case
content: Purnea MP Pappu Yadav was arrested by the Patna Police from his residence on Friday in connection with a case dating back to 1995.

title: India Condemns Islamabad Mosque Blast, Slams Pak For "Blaming Others"
content: India said it rejected "any and every" allegation of involvement in a bombing at a mosque in Islamabad on Friday, that killed at least 31 people, saying such claims were baseless and pointless.

title: Navjot Kaur Sidhu Expelled From Congress Days After She 'Quit' Party
content: AICC general secretary in-charge of Punjab Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said Navjot Kaur Sidhu has been expelled from the Congress, days after she said she had quit the party.

title: Delhi Was 2nd Most Polluted City In January After Ghaziabad: Report
content: Delhi was the second most polluted city in the country in January after Ghaziabad, as it recorded a monthly average PM2.5 concentration of 169 micrograms per cubic metre.

title: CBI Court Rejects Mehul Choksi's Plea Against Loan Fraud Case Summons
content: A special court here has rejected diamantaire Mehul Choksi's plea against summons issued to him by a magistrate in the Rs 55 crore Canara Bank-led consortium loan fraud case.

title: Pakistan Blast Highlights: Suspicion Likely To Fall On Pak Taliban, Islamic State
content: At least 69 people were killed, and 169 were injured after a suicide bomber detonated himself inside a shrine in Pakistan's capital, Islamabad.

title: Economy Better Than Goldilocks Sweet Spot: RBI Governor
content: Reserve Bank Governor Sanjay Malhotra on Friday said the economy is in a better place than the sweet spot it was in two months back, which was described by him as the "goldilocks period".

title: Working With India In Fight Against Drugs, Says US
content: In a major collaboration with Indian law enforcement in the war on drugs, US authorities have cracked down on online drug-traffickers linked to the country who are allegedly responsible for six overdose deaths in the US.

title: UK Court Rejects Nirav Modi's Plea To Delay Trial Over Vision Loss, Depression
content: The High Court in London on Friday rejected fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi's plea to delay his trial in the Bank of India unpaid loan case because he is suffering from severe vision loss, clinical depression and prison constraints.

title: 7 Maoists, Including Top Leader, Killed In Encounters In Maharashtra
content: Seven Maoists, including top leader Prabhakar, were killed in encounters with police in eastern Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district, while a police jawan also succumbed to the injuries suffered during a gunfight, officials said on Saturday.

title: India Eyes Defence, Trade Cooperation During PM Modi's Visit To Malaysia
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Malaysia from February 7-8 and hold bilateral talks with his counterpart Anwar Ibrahim.

title: Family Carry Body Home In Jholi After Ambulance Leaves Midway
content: A private ambulance abandoned a deceased patient's body midway and forced his relatives to carry it home in a make-shift cloth stretcher in Maharashtra's Palghar district, officials said on Friday.

title: Consenting Adults Have Right To Marry, Parents Can't Interfere: Delhi Court
content: Consenting adults have the constitutional right to marry each other, and neither the society nor the state machinery or their parents can interfere in their decision, the Delhi High Court has held.

title: 3 Delhi Jal Board Engineers Suspended Over Biker's Death In Pool-Sized Pit
content: Three Delhi Jal Board (DJB) engineers have been suspended after a motorcyclist allegedly fell into a construction pit dug by the water agency, cabinet minister Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma said on Friday.

title: White House Removes Trump's Racist Post On Obamas, Blames Staff Error
content: The White House said Friday that a post on President Donald Trump's social media account sharing a racist video depicting Barack Obama and his wife Michelle as monkeys was made in error by a staff member, and has been removed.

title: US Accuses China Of Conducting 'Secret Nuclear Tests'
content: Washington on Friday accused China of conducting secret nuclear explosive tests, and of preparing for more tests with massive yields, in what it said violated an international test ban.

title: Pit Where Biker Fell Was Secured With Mesh, Barricaded: Delhi Jal Board
content: The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) on Friday claimed that a pit into which a motorcyclist allegedly fell, resulting in his death, was secured with green mesh and the area had been barricaded.

title: India-Bangladesh Ties Independent Of Its Relations With Other Nations: Centre
content: India's relationship with Bangladesh is "independent of its relationship with third countries" and New Delhi continues to monitor developments having a bearing on its national interests, the government said.

title: Meloni Meets JD Vance Amid Anti-ICE Protests In Milan
content: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni met US Vice President JD Vance in Milan on Friday, hours before the opening ceremony of the Winter Olympics.

title: 'Positive Atmosphere': Iran On US Nuclear Talks In Oman
content: Iran on Friday said it expected to hold more negotiations with the United States, hailing a "positive atmosphere" during a day of indirect talks in Oman but warning against threats after Washington...
